{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

data[source]

data(day:int, parser=str, sep='\n')

Split the day's input file into sections separated by sep, and apply parser to each.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

do[source]

do(day, *answers)

E.g., do(3) returns {1: day3_1(in3), 2: day3_2(in3)}. Verifies answers if given.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

quantify[source]

quantify(iterable, pred=bool)

Count the number of items in iterable for which pred is true.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

first[source]

first(iterable, default=None)

Return first item in iterable, or default.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

rest[source]

rest(sequence)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

multimap[source]

multimap(items:Iterable[Tuple])

Given (key, val) pairs, return {key: [val, ....], ...}.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

prod[source]

prod(numbers)

The product of an iterable of numbers.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

ints[source]

ints(text:str)

Return a tuple of all the integers in text.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

atoms[source]

atoms(text:str, ignore='', sep=None)

Parse text into atoms (numbers or strs), possibly ignoring a regex.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

atom[source]

atom(text:str)

Parse text into a single float or int or str.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

dotproduct[source]

dotproduct(A, B)

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

mapt[source]

mapt(fn, *args)

map(fn, *args) and return the result as a tuple.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}
